questions.question_text:
During the regular maintenance of XSOAR a customer noticed that there was an update available for the Active Directory content pack (current version 1.4.6) and updated the content pack to the latest version (version 1.4.11). However, after the update the customer noticed that the Active Directory Query integration is not working properly and asked you to resolve the issue.

Which of the following set of steps can help to resolve the issue?

choices.C:
a) Navigate to Settings
b) View the configured integrations and select Active Directory Query c) Delete all integration instances and add all integration instances again
choices.B:
a) Navigate to Marketplace
b) View the installed content pack and select Active Directory content pack c) Select version 1.4.6 and click on "Revert to this version"
choices.A:
a) Navigate to Settings
b) View the configured integrations and select Active Directory Authentication c) Delete all integration instances and add all integration instances again
choices.D:
a) Navigate to Marketplace
b) View the installed content pack and select Active Directory content pack c) Click on uninstall content pack d) Navigate to Marketplace browser and reinstall the Active Directory content pack

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In production enviroment system, run rollback. Is B

comments.content:
Use option C if you suspect that reconfiguring the integration might fix the issue, particularly if the problem seems to be related to configuration.

Use option B if you believe the update itself is causing the problem and reverting to the previous version is a more straightforward solution.

Option C is generally recommended for resolving configuration issues, while Option B is a good fallback if the new version is problematic.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
hmm.. could be C but I am unsure. C, ensures that the updated content pack is properly configured with the new integration settings.

Options B and D are more about reverting or reinstalling the content pack, which might not address configuration issues directly.

just think about it.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
Go to: Marketplace >> find integration >> click on it >> select Version History >> choose which version to roll-back to > click on Downgrade button but otherwise B is correct yes

B is corect

 - C is useless

questions.question_text: When developing the playbook, which of the following can be used by a XSOAR Administrator?

comments.content: Yeah, it could have been C if they say its JSON not XML.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Mock incident is also in JSON NOT XML. i vote for D.

comments.content:
should be D.
as inmymind84 said

discussion.content: Should be C . Tested on labs. options are : new mock incident, playground, and 5 incidents list.

choices.D: The Debugger panel to test data with one of last fifty incidents. This will not affect the incident’s original incident data.
choices.A: The Debugger panel to test data with one of last five incidents. This will affect the incident’s original incident data.
choices.C: Debugger panel and XML data from a similar incident with New Mock Incident. This will not affect the incidents original incident data.
choices.B: Context data from existing incidents by exporting the YAML data from incidents and importing it to playbook editor.

questions.question_text: Which field type provides an interactive and editable display of table-based data?
What is a primary use case of data collection tasks?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It si ok
Its A, regardless of auth, its the primary use-case. Also, authentication is supported on Xsoar starting from a 6.6ish version. Hence, all is good

"The survey resides on an external site that does not require authentication, thereby allowing survey recipients to respond without restriction." From XSOAR...This shows that A is not the correct answer. The above is not the primary use.

choices.C: To generate new widgets for a dashboard
choices.B: To automate tasks such as parsing a file or enriching indicators
choices.D: To determine different paths in a playbook
choices.A: To allow multi-question surveys without authentication restrictions

choices.C: To automatically alert the analyst on SLA breach
choices.B: To run a script that executes on SLA assignment
choices.D: To count the time between one or more tasks
choices.A: To track SLA breaches per playbook

questions.question_text: What is the function of timer SLA fields in Cortex XSOAR?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct for describing the primary function of Timer SLA fields.
C and B relate to broader SLA management and automation, but not specifically to Timer SLA fields themselves.
